item.title: Ticket #126 (the_category produces Database SQL error and a warning) updated
item.dc:creator: mark
item.description: Hrm, posted as major when realized it is actually a crash. Please adjust type.

item.title: Ticket #129 (Need to change 1-letter codes in calendar with 2-letter codes in order ...) created
item.dc:creator: donpaolo
item.description:
The english 1-letter codes for week days are S M T W T F S

There are 2 couples: the S's and the T's

In other languages it's not so.

Need to put a smaller 2-letter code with no ambiguity:

Su Mo Tu We Th Fr Sa

so that you could translate well.

item.title: Ticket #128 (Need Delete All or Comment Flood protection) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
I currently use comment moderation in my implementation of WordPress and I think it worked wonderfully.

Except when I get comment flooded. It takes forever to go through and select delete for each comment. In those cases, instead of using Wordpress, I use MySQL to delete.

If not already in place, I suggest some sort of comment flood protection combined with a function to delete all comments listed.

item.title: Ticket #16 (WP should use HTTP headers instead of the META element) updated
item.dc:creator: Anne
item.description: That isn't the advantage of HTTP-EQUIV and it never was. When a file is saved character information can be added by using BOM.

item.title: Ticket #32 (Calendar makes no use of option "start_of_week") updated

item.description: Probably not, this bug hasn't been assigned yet.

item.title: Ticket #113 (Post content 'lost' if multiple <!--more--> (more...) tags used.) updated
item.dc:creator: tormodh
item.description:
Yes, I agree with that. My thought was in the direction of userfriendly-ness. In case any user by any reason, or without reason, adds an extra <!--more--> somewhere - any content after the second <!--more--> won't show.

Um. My reasoning is that if <!--more--> is not to be used more than once, $content shouldn't be split into more than two parts, or all subsequent parts of $content needs to be set back together.
